introduction:
• To create a simulated platform to mimic the physical lab of Chemical Thermodynamics
  • To enable formative assessment
  • To include pitfalls to make the user connect the fundamentals of Thermodynamics to the given lab
  • To try take the traditional physical lab to higher cognitive levels

experiments.name: To determine the boiling points of pure species under different pressures using Ebulliometer
To determine the infinite dilution activity coefficients (IDACs) of a binary mixture using Ebulliometer
To generate binary T-x-y data using Ebulliometer
To determine the solubility of a solid in the given solvent

objective:
• To create a simulated platform to mimic the physical lab of Chemical Thermodynamics
  • To enable formative assessment
  • To include pitfalls to make the user connect the fundamentals of Thermodynamics to the given lab
  • To try take the traditional physical lab to higher cognitive levels

courseAlignment.description: The syllabi of this lab aligns to the following universities in India.
universities: Nirma University; Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics (2CH404); B. Tech
Dharamsinh Desai University; Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics – I (CH-503); B. Tech
Dharamsinh Desai University; Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics – II (CH-603); B. Tech
Institute of Chemical Technology Mumbai; Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics – I (CET1301); B. Tech
Institute of Chemical Technology Mumbai; Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics – II (CET1302); B. Tech
The M S University of Baroda; Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics (CHL 1503); B. Tech
